","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl09_divTabs_1","title":"Williams Uniform Complaint","content":"
VESD
\n\n
WILLIAMS UNIFORM COMPLAINT RIGHTS
\nDERECHOS BAJO LA LEGISLACIÓN DEL ACUERDO JUDICIAL WILLIAMS\n
NOTICE TO PARENTS/GUARDIANS/PUPILS/TEACHERS/STAFF Notificación para padres de familia, tutores legales, alumnos, maestros, y personal escolar\n
Education Code 35186 requires that the following notice be posted in each classroom:
\nEl Código de Educación de California, artículo 35186 requiere que la siguiente notificación se fije en cada salón de clases:\n
1. There should be sufficient textbooks and instructional materials. For there to be sufficient textbooks and instructional materials, each pupil, including English learners, must have a textbook or instructional materials, or both, to use in class and to take home as defined in Education Code 60119.\n
1. Debe haber suficientes libros de texto y materiales de instrucción. Eso significa que cada alumno, incluyendo a los alumnos que aprenden el idioma inglés, debe tener un libro de texto o materiales de instrucción, o ambos, para usar en clase y llevar a casa, según lo define el Código de Educación 60119.\n
2. School facilities must be clean, safe, and maintained in good repair as defined in Education Code 17002; and school restrooms must be cleaned, maintained, or kept open in accordance with Education Code 35292.5. Clean or maintained school restroom means a school restroom has been cleaned or maintained regularly, is fully operational, or has been stocked at all times with toilet paper, soap, and paper towels or functional hand dryers.\n
2. Las instalaciones escolares deben estar limpias, seguras, y deberán mantenerse en buen estado, según lo define el Código de Educación 17002; y los baños escolares deben estar limpios, mantenerse en buen estado o abiertos de acuerdo al Código de Educación 35292.5. Un baño limpio y con buen mantenimiento significa que un baño escolar ha sido limpiado o se le ha dado mantenimiento de forma regular, funciona debidamente, o siempre ha contado con rollo de papel, jabón, y tollas de papel o secador de manos funcional.\n
3. There should be no teacher vacancies or misassignments as defined in Education Code 35186(h) (2) and (3). Teacher vacancy means a position to which a single designated certificated employee has not been assigned at the beginning of the year for an entire year or, if the position is for a one- semester course, a position to which a single designated certificated employee has not been assigned at the beginning of the semester for an entire semester. Misassignment means the placement of a certificated employee in a teaching or services position for which the employee does not hold a legally recognized certificate or credential.\n
3. No deben existir plazas vacantes de maestros ni asignaciones incorrectas de maestros según lo define el Código de Educación 35186(h) (2) y (3). Vacante de maestro significa una plaza a la que un maestro acreditado no ha sido asignado al inicio del año y por todo un año, o si la plaza es para un curso de un semestre, una plaza a la que un maestro acreditado no ha sido asignado al inicio del semestre y por un semestre completo. Una asignación incorrecta significa la colocación de un empleado certificado en una plaza o área de servicios para la cual no cuenta con los títulos o acreditaciones reconocidas legalmente.\n
If you feel we are not adequately meeting these requirements, you have the right to file a complaint with the principal of this school.
\nSi usted considera que no estamos cumpliendo de forma adecuada con estos requisitos, usted tiene el derecho de presentar una queja ante el director de esta escuela.\n
To file a complaint regarding the above matters, complaint forms can be obtained at the principal’s office.
\nPara presentar una queja sobre los asuntos anteriormente descritos, puede dirigirse a la oficina del director y solicitar un formulario de queja.\n
All complaints must be resolved within 30 days.
\nTodas las quejas deben ser resueltas dentro de los primeros 30 días.\n
Revised 10/08 \nWilliams Uniform Complaint Form

","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl09_divTabs_4","title":"Lunch Forms","content":"
Religious Belief Form 
\nPlease fill out this form if your child should avoid certain foods due to religious beliefs.
\n
\nSpecial Meals and-or Accommodations Form - English
\nThis form is to be used when: Participant has a disability or a medical condition and requires a special meal or accommodation. Participant does not have a disability, but is requesting a special meal or accommodation due to food intolerance(s) or medical reasons. \n
Delaración Médica Para Solicitar Comidas Especiales o Adaptaciones
\nSu forma debe ser usado cuando: participante tiene una discapacidad o una condición médica y requiere una especial comida o alojamiento. Participante no tiene una discapacidad, pero está solicitando a una comida especial o alojamiento debido a la intolerance(s) de alimentos o por otras razones médicas.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl09_divTabs_5","title":"Title IX Notification","content":"\n    
The District’s Title IX Coordinator 
\n    \n\n
Tanya Benitez, Asst. Supt. of Pupil Services\n
Victor Elementary School District\n
12219 2nd Ave\n
Victorville, CA. 92394 \n
760-245-1691 x 12700\n
tbenitez@vesd.net \n\n    
Summary of Student Rights (Education Code section 221.8)\n\n\n    \n        \n            \n                
You have the right to fair and equitable treatment and to be free from discrimination based on your sex.\n                
You have the right to an equitable opportunity to participate in all academic extracurricular activities, including athletics.\n                
You have the right to ask the athletic director of your school about the athletic opportunities offered by the school.\n                
You have the right to apply for athletic scholarships.\n                
You have the right to equitable treatment and benefits in: \n                \n                    
\t(1)Equipment and supplies\n                    
\t(2)Scheduling of games and practices\n                    
\t(3)Transportation and daily allowances\n                    
\t(4)Access to tutoring\n                    
\t(5)Coaching\n                    
\t(6)Locker rooms\n                    
\t(7)Practice and competitive facilities\n                    
\t(8)Medical and training facilities and services\n                    
\t(9)Publicity\n                \n                \n                
You have access to a gender equity coordinator to answer questions about gender equity laws.\n                
You have the right to contact the California Department of Education (CDE) and the California Interscholastic Federation (CIF) for information on gender equity laws.\n                
You have the right to file a confidential discrimination complaint with the United States Office for Civil Rights (OCR) or CDE if you believe you have been discriminated against or received unequal treatment on the basis of your sex.\n                
You have the right to pursue civil remedies if you have been discriminated against.\n                
You have the right to be protected from retaliation if you file a discrimination complaint.\n            \n        \n    \n\n
For more information regarding student rights under Title IX, please visit:\n
The California Office of Equal Opportunity at http://www.cde.ca.gov/re/di/eo/genequitytitleix.asp.\n
\n
The United States Department of Education Office for Civil Rights at https://www2.ed.gov/about/offices/list/ocr/docs/title-ix-rights-201104.html.\n
\n\n    
The School’s Responsibilities \n\n
Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 prohibits discrimination based on sex in programs and activities of federally funded institutions. School district programs and activities must be operated free from discrimination. Key areas addressed by Title IX include: athletics; sexual misconduct, including sexual harassment and sexual violence; pregnant and parenting students; off-campus activities; recruitment and admission; and employment. Schools must protect against discrimination in these areas. Schools must also prohibit retaliation against any person for opposing an unlawful practice or policy, or filing, testifying about, or participating in any complaint under Title IX. \n
For more information about schools’ responsibilities under Title IX, please visit:\n
The California Office of Equal Opportunity at http://www.cde.ca.gov/re/di/eo/titleixnotification.asp. \n
The United States Department of Education Office of Civil Rights at https://www2.ed.gov/about/offices/list/ocr/docs/tix_dis.html.\n\n    
How to File a Title IX Complaint \n\n
Individuals who believe they have been discriminated against in violation of Title IX may file a complaint directly with the District (contact information is shared above for your reference) or the Office for Civil Rights (OCR). If a crime is involved, such as sexual assault, individuals may also file a report with the local police department. A person may pursue one or all of these avenues at the same time. Below is a summary of each process.\n\n    \n        
District Complaint\n    \n\n
Title IX complaints may be filed using the District’s uniform complaint procedure, Board Policy 1312.3.\n
Time Requirement:\n
A complaint with the District must be filed within six months of the discrimination occurring or your awareness of the discrimination (5 CCR 4630(b)).  \n
If you have any questions about this time limit, or if you believe your complaint may be outside this time requirement but want to explore other options, please contact the Title IX Coordinator.\n
Investigation Procedure:\n
Upon receipt of any complaint related to a potential Title IX violation, the District will ensure every allegation is investigated promptly, adequately and impartially.  The District will also take steps to protect all complainants from retaliation and ensure all parties are treated fairly throughout the District’s investigation process. As part of its Title IX obligations, the District also takes steps to prevent recurrence of any sexual violence and remedy discriminatory effects on the complainant and others, as appropriate. The District’s procedure for investigating a Title IX complaint can be found at Board Policy 1312.3.\n
Please contact the Title IX Coordinator if you have any questions.\n\n    \n        
OCR Complaint\n    \n\n
For information regarding filing a complaint with OCR, please see https://www2.ed.gov/about/offices/list/ocr/complaintintro.html.\n
OCR provides an online complaint filing system at https://ocrcas.ed.gov/.\n
OCR can also be contacted through the California regional office at:\n
Office for Civil Rights
\nU.S. Department of Education
\n50 United Nations Plaza
\nMail Box 1200, Room 1545
\nSan Francisco, CA 94102 \n
Telephone: 415-486-5555\n
Email: ocr.sanfrancisco@ed.gov\n
Time Requirement:\n
OCR requires that the complaint be filed within 180 calendar days of the discrimination. Please contact OCR, or visit the websites above, if you have any questions or concerns about this time requirement. \n
\t\tInvestigation Procedure:\n
For information regarding OCR’s investigation process, please see https://www2.ed.gov/about/offices/list/ocr/complaints-how.html.\n\n    \n        
Police Report \n    \n\n
To file a police report, please contact San Bernardino County Sheriff’s Department. Victor Elementary School District contracts with deputies directly in this department:\n
\n
Deputy Bennignton\n
Deputy Graham\n
\n
Address: 14200 Amargosa Rd, Victorville, CA 92392\n
Phone: (760) 956-5001\n

\n\n
","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl09_divTabs_6","title":"Bus Camera Letter","content":"
 \n
 \n
June 1, 2019 \n
 Dear Parents/Guardians,\n
 This letter is to inform you that all Victor Elementary school buses will be equipped with surveillance cameras for the 2019-2020 school year. The surveillance cameras will improve safety and security for our students, drivers, and VESD staff. The intent of the use of video surveillance cameras is to deter anyone who does not have reason to board a VESD bus, to ensure proper driver protocols are being followed and to deter students, and parents/guardians from inappropriate behavior. All recordings may be used by the district and or law enforcement for disciplinary purposes whenever appropriate.\n
 All bus cameras will be situated in specific areas and will take images to help maintain a safe and orderly environment. The installation of these surveillance cameras are just one means we are using to create a safe, secure, and orderly environment for students, staff, and drivers.\n
 Sincerely,\n
 Don Lester
\nDirector of Safety, Operations and Transportation
\nVictor Elementary School District
\n\n
\n\n
 \n
 Junio 1, 2019\n
Queridos Padres/Tutores,
\n\n
 Esta carta es para informarles que todos los autobuses del Distrito de Escuelas Primarias Victor estarán equipados con cámaras de vigilancia a partir del año escolar 2018-2019. Las cámaras de vigilancia mejorarán la seguridad de nuestros estudiantes, conductores y personal de VESD. La intención del uso de las cámaras de video-vigilancia es para impedir a cualquier persona que no tenga razón de subirse a bordo de un autobús de VESD, asegurar que se sigan los protocolos apropiados del conductor, y disuadir a los estudiantes y a los padres/tutores del comportamiento inapropiado. Todas las grabaciones pueden ser utilizadas por el distrito o la policía para propósitos disciplinarios cuando sea apropiado.\n
 Todas las cámaras de los autobuses estarán situadas en áreas específicas y tomarán imágenes para ayudar a mantener un entorno seguro y ordenado. La instalación de estas cámaras de vigilancia es solo uno de los medios que estamos utilizando para crear un entorno seguro y ordenado para los estudiantes, el personal, y los conductores.\n
 Atentamente,\n
Don Lester
\n\n
Director de Seguridad, Operaciones y Transportación
\nDistrito de Escuelas Primarias Victor\n
 \n
 \n
 \n
 \n
 \n
 \n
 ","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl09_divTabs_7","title":"Surveillance Camera Letter","content":"
  July 2019\n
 Dear Parents/Guardians,\n
 This letter is to inform you that all Victor Elementary schools have had surveillance cameras installed on the outsides of all schools. The surveillance cameras can improve safety for students and employees and improve security for schools, offices and personal property. The intent of the use of video surveillance cameras is to deter anyone who does not have a reason to be on a VESD campus and to deter students from inappropriate behavior.\n
 All cameras shall be situated in specific areas and take images of only those areas that are considered public places, where there is no expectation of privacy, for example: school entrances, hallways, exterior of buildings and other open areas on campuses. The cameras will not be installed in any place or take images of any place where students, staff, or visitors may have a reasonable expectation of privacy such as restrooms and classrooms.  The installation of these surveillance cameras are just one means that we are using to create a safe, secure, and orderly learning environment for students, staffs, and families. \n
 Sincerely,\n
 Don Lester
\nDirector of Safety, Operations and Transportation
\nVictor Elementary School District\n
 \n\n
 Julio 2019\n
 Queridos Padres/Tutores,\n
 Esta carta es para informarle de que a todas las escuelas del Victor Elementary se le han instalado cámaras de vigilancia en el exterior de todas las escuelas. Las cámaras de vigilancia pueden mejorar la seguridad de los estudiantes y los empleados y mejorar la seguridad para las escuelas, oficinas y bienes personales. La intención del uso de cámaras de vigilancia de video es disuadir a cualquier persona que no tenga una razón para estar en un campus de VESD y disuadir a los estudiantes de la conducta inapropiada.\n
 Todas las cámaras estarán situadas en zonas específicas y tomaran imagines de solo aquellas áreas que se consideran lugares públicos, donde no hay expectativas de privacidad, por ejemplo: entradas de las escuelas, pasillos, exterior de los edificios y otras áreas abiertas en los campus. Las cámaras no se pueden instalar en cualquier lugar o tomar imágenes de cualquier lugar en el que los estudiantes, el personal o los visitantes pueden tener una expectativa razonable de privacidad, tales como en los baños y salones. La instalación de estas cámaras de vigilancia es solo uno de los medios que utilizamos para crear un ambiente de aprendizaje seguro y ordenado para los estudiantes, personal y familia. \n
 Sinceramente,\n
 Don Lester
\nDirector de Seguridad, Operaciones and Transportación
\nVictor Elementary School District
\n\n
 \n

                };

                activate();
            }
        }
